summary: The Reducing Hereditary Cancer Act (H.R. 4752) amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide coverage for hereditary cancer genetic testing for individuals with a family history or suspicious personal history. It also covers certain cancer screenings and preventive surgeries based on evidence-based guidelines for individuals with germline mutations. The bill specifies testing guidelines, frequency limitations and effective dates for the new provisions. Further, it broadens coverage for evidence-based screenings for those with hereditary cancer mutations and amends existing legislation regarding screening mammography.
